chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Zabala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If defendant disputes restitution amount, hearing may be scheduled.
Restitution joint and several with co defendant due during term of probation.  The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Deceased per DOC, DOD: 11/25/2015
DECEASED PER DOC

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence. If defendant objects to restitution amount, he may notify the court and a restitution hearing will be held.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-04-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed the competency report. Atty. Alme Boaz does not oppose competency finding. Court finds the defendant competent to proceed. Atty. Alme Boaz requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Alme Boaz motion for competency evaluation. Court orders competency evaluation  and adjourns case for hearing on 4/28/2015.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Restitution hearing/Plea & Sentencing removed from the Court's calendar on 3/11/2015 on request of Atty. Alme Boaz. DA no objection. Court is informed Atty. Alme Boaz will be filing a motion re: competency.
Restitution hearing on March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requesting adj for plea/sentencing as well as a restitution hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State's notice, demand, and motion for discovery and inspection.
State's
Further proceedings on February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

W/CONDITION: no contact with co-defendant, victim S.M. or D.M. or their residence, absolute sobriety,  no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.

Defendant Andrew J Zabala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Court is informed defendant qualifies for the public defender, may have conflict. State recommendation of $500 cash bail w/condition no contact with co defendant or victims. Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing, requests status date. Court orders $500 cash bail w/conditions.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
Defendant contacted the clerk stating he did not receive notice of hearing but was made aware of a missed court date and warrant. He will turn himself into the Ozaukee or Milwaukee Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Andrew J Zabala not in court. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed summons returned undeliverable. Court finds probable cause, orders arrest warrant issued. Forfeit bail, if any.
Initial appearance on December 10, 2014 at 08:45 am.
